page.title: 13EVENTS continued
page.content: The carnival Queen led the floats. She had two small attendants and one large one. The floats were great. There was the House of the Rising Sun which was Chinese and Puff the magic Dragon which had a dragon's head that kept going up and down. The Teddy Bears was made by the brownies and won first prize. The Guides were dressed up as 'flappers'. There was a mock army tank, Andy Pandy and many more. The fancy dress was judged in age groups and many people won. There was a brass band from Middleton in Teesdale and four jazz bands. When the procession finished there were the competitions in the Scarth Hall. There were some marvellous things such as paintings, collage and decorations. On Sunday afternoon it was the sports, where everyone joined in. It was all great fun, especially the three legged race.
